transcript:
rose from the table and sat down in the entrance porch which served as a veranda. 
"Come, let's argue then," said Prince An- drew. "You talk of schools," he went on, crook- 
ing a finger, "education and so forth; that is, you want to raise him" (pointing to a peasant who passed by them taking off his cap) "from his animal condition and awaken in him spir- itual needs, while it seems to me that animal happiness is the only happiness possible, and that is just what you want to deprive him of.
